items.name: Water Jet - Line (Costs 2 Actions).
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon discharges a beam of high pressurized water from its mouth or tail in a 1200-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in a line must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions).
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the equal dragon weapon must succeed on a {@dc 28} Dexterity saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The equal dragon weapon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

items.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: Each living creature within 20 feet of the equal dragon weapon must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Frost Armor (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon coats itself in a layer of frost and ice for 1 minute, until it takes 40 fire damage from a spell or until takes 60 damage from any other single attack. While coated in this way, the equal dragon weapon has +3 bonus to its AC.

items.name: Hail Storm (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon forms five boulder-sized chunks of ice from the water in the air that plummet to the ground at different points within 90 feet of it. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on each point, must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 9 ({damage 2d8}) cold damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one ice chunk is affected only once.

items.name: Blue Meteor (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon opens its mouth and creates three swirling balls of blue fire, launching them into the sky, each of which can strike a different target the equal dragon weapon can see within 120 feet of it. A target must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Piercing Roar (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon lets out an ear shattering roar. Each creature that is within 20 feet of the equal dragon weapon must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Whirlwind (Costs 3 Actions)
items.entry: The equal dragon weapon chooses 3 unoccupied 5-foot cube within 5 feet of it. An elemental force that resembles a dust devil appears in the cubes and they move in a straight line 120 feet away from the equal dragon weapon before dispersing. Each creature in one of the lines must make a {@dc 25} Strength saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) force damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The guild knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: R.Ludroth Tail (3/long rest)
entries: When the guild knight takes damage they are not immune or resistant to, roll a d4 and reduce the damage taken by the amount rolled.

trait.name: Passive Materials
entries: The following materials are already included in other parts of the stat block: Nerscylla Shell (A), Tobi Electro Sac (W).

trait.name: Uncommon Sword and Shield
entries: The guild knight wields an {@item sword and shield (u)|AGMH|uncommon sword and shield}, that increases their AC by 1, and attack and damage rolls by +1 when they attack with it (included in the attack and AC).

trait.name: Free Hands
entries: The guild knight can "{@action use an object}" as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guild knight makes two attacks with their sword and shield.

action.name: Sword and Shield
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage.

reaction.name: Hypno Claw
entries: {@i Taunt.} When a creature the guild knight can see attacks a target other than them that is within 5 feet of them, they can use their reaction to redirect the attack to themselves.

entries.name: Guild Knight Stat Blocks
entries: The guild knight stat blocks use materials found in the Monster Hunter Monster Loot Tables. The materials can be swapped, but it is best to swap the materials with others from the same CR range.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The guild knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Kirin Tail. (3/long rest)
entries: When the guild knight takes damage they are not immune or resistant to, roll a d6 and reduce the damage taken by the amount rolled.

trait.name: Odogaron Fang
entries: The guild knight's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Unnamed Material
entries: The guild knight has resistance to a damage type appropriate to the situation they expect to be in, excluding bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage.

trait.name: Passive Materials
entries: The following materials are already included in other parts of the stat block: Blangonga Fang (W), Dodogama Talon (W), Gypceros Webbing (A).

trait.name: Rare Gunlance
entries: The guild knight wields a {@item gunlance (r)|AGMH|rare gunlance}, that increases their attack and damage rolls by +1 when they attack with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guild knight makes two attacks with their gunlance. It can replace any one of these attacks with its shell attack.

action.name: Gunlance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Shell (3/short rest)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/100 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) fire damage.

action.name: Wyvernfire (2/long rest)
entries: The guild knight loads a special shell into the gunlance releasing flames in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature hit must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entries.name: Guild Knight Stat Blocks
entries: The guild knight stat blocks use materials found in the Monster Hunter Monster Loot Tables. The materials can be swapped, but it is best to swap the materials with others from the same CR range.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The guild knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Glavenus Plate
entries: {@i Heavy Polish.} The guild knight's insect glaive ignores a creature's resistance to slashing damage.

trait.name: Glavenus Pyroshell
entries: Any creature that hits the guild knight with a melee weapon, an unarmed strike, or a natural melee weapon takes 1d6 fire damage.

trait.name: Gravios Carapace
entries: The guild knight deals an extra ({@damage 1d6}) weapon damage when they critically hit with this weapon.

trait.name: Velkhana Cortex (4/long rest)
entries: When the guild knight takes damage they are not immune or resistant to, roll a d8 and reduce the damage taken by the amount rolled.

trait.name: Unnamed Material
entries: The guild knight is resistant to a damage type appropriate to the situation they expect to be in, excluding bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage.

trait.name: Passive Materials
entries: The following materials are already included in other parts of the stat block: Shell Shocker (W), and Nargacuga Pelt (A).

trait.name: Very Rare Insect Glaive
entries: The guild knight wields a {@item insect glaive (vr)|AGMH|very rare insect glaive}, that increases their attack and damage rolls by +2 when they attack with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Kinsect Essence
entries: The guild knight is always under the effects of all kinsect essence effects (already included in their AC, Damage, and Speed).

trait.name: Kinsect Mastery
entries: The guild knight can use its bonus action to have their kinsect act as if it was summoned by the {@spell find familiar} spell, with the following differences:

items: It can only be used in this way for a total of 1 hour each day, it cannot be dismissed, instead they can use an action to call it back to them, when its hit points reaches 0 it reappears on their insect glaive at full hit points and will resume what it was last doing unless told otherwise, and the guild knight cannot use their kinsect attack action while it is being used in this way.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The guild knight is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The guild knight has the following paladin spells prepared:

spells: a smite spell ({@spell searing smite}, {@spell thunderous smite}, or {@spell wrathful smite})

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guild knight makes two attacks with their insect glaive.

action.name: Insect Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Kinsect
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d12}) bludgeoning damage and the guild knight heals for half the damage dealt.

action.name: Standing Leap
entries: The guild knight can make a standing leap forward or upwards, covering up to a 25 foot distance. They can make an insect glaive attack against a target when they land or during the leap.

action.name: Fearsome Maw (1/day)
entries: The guild knight regains a spell slot of 3rd level or lower.

entries.name: Guild Knight Stat Blocks
entries: The guild knight stat blocks use materials found in the Monster Hunter Monster Loot Tables. The materials can be swapped, but it is best to swap the materials with others from the same CR range.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The guild knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Dragonmoss
entries: The guild knight's hammer attacks bypass the damage resistance of any creature.

trait.name: Rubbery Hide
entries: The guild knight can speak the weapons command word and transform it into a fishing pole with a hook, a line, and a reel. Speaking the command word again changes the fishing pole back into the weapon.

trait.name: Savage Tallfang
entries: The guild knight deals an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) weapon damage when they critically hit.

trait.name: T.Velkhana Cortex (5/long rest)
entries: When the guild knight takes damage they are not immune or resistant to, roll a d10 and reduce the damage taken by the amount rolled.

trait.name: Unnamed Material
entries: The guild knight is immune to a damage type appropriate to the situation they expect to be in, excluding bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage.

trait.name: Passive Materials
entries: The following materials are already included in other parts of the stat block: Dragonmoss (A, Strength is 20 otherwise), Dalam Tail Scale (A), Malfestio Tailfeather (A), Mizutsune Water Gem (W), T.Teostra Claw (W).

trait.name: Legendary Hammer
entries: The guild knight wields a {@item hammer (l)|AGMH|legendary hammer}, that increases their attack and damage rolls by +3 when they attack with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the guild knight moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a hammer attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 3d4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Mighty Weapon (4/Day)
entries: When the guild knight hits a creature with their hammer, they can choose to have that creature make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the guild knight's next turn on a failed save.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The guild knight is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The guild knight has the following paladin spells prepared:

spells: a smite spell ({@spell searing smite}, {@spell thunderous smite}, or {@spell wrathful smite})

footerEntries: {@i **Always prepared due to Mizutsune Water Gem Material.}

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guild knight makes two attacks with their hammer.

action.name: Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The guild knight makes one attack with its hammer.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The guild knight makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The guild knight casts a spell from its list of prepared spells.

entries.name: Guild Knight Stat Blocks
entries: The guild knight stat blocks use materials found in the Monster Hunter Monster Loot Tables. The materials can be swapped, but it is best to swap the materials with others from the same CR range.

object.name: Dragonator

immune.special: All damage that isn't siege damage

entries: A Dragonator is any powered melee system that deploys massive spikes used to damage monsters. They are regularly installed in strategic locations to help in battle with large monsters. Dragonators consist of at least three pieces: the machinery, the weapon, and the control unit. Little is known about the machinery, other than the fact that it uses pressurized steam to launch the weapon. The steam is provided by a coal-fed fire.

The weapon itself consists of two massive rod-like objects, which are separated by 5 feet of space between them, and propelled by the steam at high velocities outward striking any creature in a 15 foot line in front of them. A Huge or larger creature can be hit by both dragonators, while a Large or smaller creature can only be hit by one.

The weapon can be as simple as iron spears (3d6 piercing damage), or as complex as spiky, spinning drills (10d10) piercing damage. There can be multiple rods launched from each Dragonator. The dragonnator only requires the switch or lever to be used to activate the dragonator.

attackEntries: {@hit +12} to hit, reach 15 ft., all creatures in a straight line within its reach.
hitEntries: the creature takes damage determined by the type of dragonator. {@i Miss:} Creature takes half as much damage.

object.name: Dragonrazer

immune.special: All damage that isn't siege damage

entries: A Dragonrazer is a large cannon that uses dragonrazer fuel cells to propel a large explosive harpoon through the air at destructive speeds.

A dragonrazer is supported on a large swiveling metal platform. Before it can be fired, the dragonrazer must be loaded with two fuel cells (75 lbs each) and aimed. It takes one action to load each full cell, one action to aim it, and one action to fire it.

attackEntries: {@hit +8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target.
hitEntries: 27 ({@damage 5d10}) piercing damage and explodes. {@i Miss:} The harpoon lands 1d8 spaces away from the target in a random direction and then explodes. A creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere of the harpoon when it explodes must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

object.name: Large Boulder
entries: A large boulder might be hanging from a large group of vines far overhead, or a chunk of the mountain side. In an arena, the boulder might be held above the arena floor by ropes and pulleys. The boulder doesn't necessarily have to be a boulder, it could be an ancient tree trunk or part of a building that comes toppling down.
The boulder can be knocked loose by attacking it, by a lever, or some other way to release it as a trap.

Any creature under the boulder when it hits the ground must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, is not knocked prone, and is pushed into an unoccupied space adjacent to the boulder.

optionalfeature.name: Accelerator Gauge
entries: When you hit with this weapon, you gain 1 charge up to a maximum of 5. You lose all charges, if you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or don't hit a target within 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Detonation Velocity
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend any number of {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charges} to increase your weapon's damage by +1 for each charge expended.

optionalfeature.name: Accel Jump
entries: When you jump, you can expend {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charges} to increase your jump's height or distance by an extra 5 feet for each charge expended. If the weapon is very rare or higher, the distance or height is increased by an additional 5 feet per charge.

optionalfeature.name: Burst Slash
entries: As an action you can expend up to 5 {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charges} to unleash an accelerated slash against a creature within 5 feet of you. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Strength Modifier. On a failed save, the target takes #d4 slashing damage, where # is equal to the number of charges expended. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.
This damage is increased to #d6 at rare, #d8 at very rare, and #d10 at legendary.

optionalfeature.name: Dash Burst
entries: As a bonus action you can expend 1 {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charge} to dash up to half of your movement speed. You can expend extra charges to move an additional 10 feet for each additional charge you expend.

optionalfeature.name: Evade Slash
entries: When you hit a hostile creature with this weapon, you can expend 3 {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charges} to move up to 15 feet in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Heat Gauge
entries: When you use one of this weapon's properties that expends {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charge(s)}, you gain 1 heat up to a maximum of 3.

optionalfeature.name: Full Accel Mode
entries: As a bonus action you can expend 3 {@optfeature Heat Gauge|AGMH|heat} to enter full accel mode. Until the end of your next turn this weapon's reach increases to 10 feet, it deals an extra 1d6 slashing damage, and your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Blast Evade
entries: When you are subject to the effect of an area-of-effect attack, spell, or spell-like ability; you can use your reaction to expend a number of {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charges} to try and move yourself out of the area. For each charge you expend, you can move 5 feet in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. If you leave the area-of-effect's area, you are no longer considered a target of it.

optionalfeature.name: Hyper Burst Slash
entries: While you are in {@optfeature full accel mode|AGMH}, your {@optfeature burst slash|AGMH} damage is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Mid-Air Dash Slash
entries: {@i 2/turn}
When hit you a creature with an attack while in the air, you can expend a {@optfeature Accelerator Gauge|AGMH|charge} to move up to 10 feet in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Switch Mode (CB)
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch the weapon between its axe or sword and shield mode.

items: {@b Axe Mode} {@i 1d12 slashing, 7 lb, heavy, two-handed}
{@b Sword & Shield Mode} {@i 1d6 slashing, +2 AC, 8 lb, finesse, light}

optionalfeature.name: Phial Charge
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapons sword and shield {@optfeature switch mode (cb)|AGMH|mode}, it gains 1 phial charge up to a maximum of 5. The charges last until your next short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Guard
entries: {@b Sword}

As a reaction, when you are hit by an attack you can expend 1 {@optfeature phial charge|AGMH|phial} to deal {@damage 1d4} damage to the creature, this damage is done as your choice of acid, cold, fire, or lightning.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Discharge
entries: {@b Axe}

As a bonus action upon hitting a creature, you can expend 1 {@optfeature phial charge|AGMH|phial} to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage to the target, this damage is done as your choice of acid, cold, fire, or lightning.
This damage is increased to 1d8 at very rare and 1d10 at legendary.

optionalfeature.name: Amped Element Discharge
entries: As an action you can expend any number of {@optfeature phial charge|AGMH}s and release a shockwave of acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice) in a 15-foot cone in front of you. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Strength modifier taking #d4 of your chosen damage type, where # is the number of phials you have expended on a failed save. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
This damage is increased to #d6 at very rare and #d8 at legendary.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Guard Upgrade
entries: Your {@optfeature elemental guard|AGMH} now deals {@damage 1d6} acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Discharge Upgrade I
entries: Your {@optfeature elemental discharge|AGMH} now deals {@damage 1d8} acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Amped Element Discharge Upgrade I
entries: Your {@optfeature amped element discharge|AGMH} now deals #d6 acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Discharge Upgrade II
entries: Your {@optfeature elemental discharge|AGMH} now deals {@damage 1d10} acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Amped Element Discharge Upgrade II
entries: Your {@optfeature amped element discharge|AGMH} now deals #d8 acid, cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice). Additionally you double the damage against a Huge or larger creature if the entire 15-foot cone is its space.

optionalfeature.name: Demon Mode
entries: {@b 2/long rest}

As a bonus action your body is enveloped in a demonic aura for 30 seconds or until you are knocked {@condition prone}. While Demon mode is active, you gain +5 movement speed, and deal an extra {@damage 1d4} weapon damage on the first attack that hits each turn. Once demon mode ends you cannot use it again for 30 seconds.

optionalfeature.name: Demon Mode Upgrade
entries: You can use {@optfeature demon mode|AGMH} one extra time (3 total) between long rests, its movement speed bonus increases to 10 feet, and you now deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage on all weapon attacks while demon mode is active.

optionalfeature.name: Inflict
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon where they make a saving throw against a condition causing effect, the save DC is increased by 1.

Condition causing effects can include spells and abilities such as the Ranger's {@spell ensnaring strike}, some of the Battlemaster's {@filter combat maneuvers|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B}, or any magical condition inflicting effect the GM may put on this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Archdemon Mode
entries: You can use {@optfeature demon mode|AGMH} one extra time (4 total) between long rests and its movement speed bonus increases to 15 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Inflict Upgrade I
entries: Your save DC for {@optfeature inflict|AGMH|condition causing effects} by this weapon is now increased by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Archdemon Mode Upgrade
entries: You can use {@optfeature demon mode|AGMH} one extra time (5 total) between long rests, its movement speed bonus increases to 20 feet, and you now deal an extra {@damage 1d6} weapon damage while demon mode is active.

optionalfeature.name: Inflict Upgrade II
entries: Your save DC for {@optfeature inflict|AGMH|condition causing effects} by this weapon is now increased by 3.

optionalfeature.name: Charged Slash
entries: As part of the {@action Attack} action or when you make an opportunity attack you can forgo an attack with this weapon in order to grant the weapon 1 charge (3 max). Charges are lost if not used within 1 minute.

When you make an attack roll while the weapon has any charges, all charges are expended and that attack is made with advantage; you can forgo this advantage and all other advantages you gain on this turn to gain 1 extra charge to expend on this attack.

On hit the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier as weapon damage + the weapon's extra damage material (if it has one) for each charge expended in this way, plus an extra 3 damage if you expended 2 charges, or 6 damage if you expended 3 charges.

optionalfeature.name: Guard (GS)
entries: As a reaction, you add 2 AC against one melee attack that would hit you. To do so, you must see the attacker and be wielding the greatsword. You have disadvantage on attacks until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Charged Slash Upgrade I
entries: Your {@optfeature charged slash|AGMH|charge slash} now deals an extra {@damage 1d8} + your Strength modifier as weapon damage + the weapon's extra damage material (if it has one) for each charge expended in this way, plus an extra 3 damage if you expended 2 charges, or 6 damage if you expended 3 charges.

optionalfeature.name: Guard Upgrade I (GS)
entries: You now gain a +3 bonus to your AC when you use {@optfeature guard|AGMH|this reaction}.

optionalfeature.name: Charged Slash Upgrade II
entries: Your {@optfeature charged slash|AGMH|charge slash} now deals an extra {@damage 1d10} + your Strength modifier as weapon damage + the weapon's extra damage material (if it has one) for each charge expended in this way, plus an extra 3 damage if you expended 2 charges, or 6 damage if you expended 3 charges.

optionalfeature.name: Guard Upgrade II (GS)
entries: You now gain a +4 bonus to your AC when you use {@optfeature guard|AGMH|this reaction}.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Draw
entries: When you draw or pickup this weapon you can don your shield as part of the same interaction.

optionalfeature.name: Shells
entries: Your gunlance holds up to three shells. As an action you can expend a shell to make a melee or ranged weapon attack against a target. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the {@action Attack} action, this attack replaces one of them. This attack has an reach of 10-feet or a range of 80/320, dealing {@damage 1d8} fire damage. You can reload one expended shell as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Guard Reload
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee weapon attack while you are holding your shield, you reload one expended {@optfeature shells|AGMH|shell}.

optionalfeature.name: Shells Upgrade I
entries: Your gunlance can now hold up to four {@optfeature shells|AGMH}.

optionalfeature.name: Wyvernfire
entries: As a bonus action, you can load a special shell into the gunlance and use your action to release flames in a 30-foot long line that is 5-feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier. Taking {@damage 3d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. One you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Blast Dash
entries: While wielding this weapon you can take the {@action dash} action as a bonus action. You can use this property a number of time equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Charged Shelling
entries: When you make a ranged weapon attack with your {@optfeature shells|AGMH} you can expend two extra shells to have the target make a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier. On a failed save the target takes an extra {@damage 2d10} fire damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save the target takes {@damage 1d10} fire damage and isn't knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Shells Upgrade II
entries: Your gunlance can now hold up to five {@optfeature shells|AGMH} and it now deals {@damage 1d10} fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Wyvernfire Upgrade I
entries: Your {@optfeature wyvernfire|AGMH|wyvern fire} now releases a gout of flame in a 45-foot long line that is 5-feet wide and deals {@damage 4d6} fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Charge Shelling Upgrade
entries: Your {@optfeature charged shelling|AGMH} now deals an extra {@damage 2d12} fire damage on a failed save, or {@damage 1d12} fire damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Shells Upgrade III
entries: Your gunlance {@optfeature shells|AGMH} now deals {@damage 1d12} fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Wyvernfire Upgrade II
entries: Your {@optfeature wyvernfire|AGMH|wyvern fire} now releases a gout of flame in a 60-foot long line that is 5-feet wide and deals {@damage 5d6} fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Weapon
entries: When you hit a creature that is Large or smaller with this weapon, you can choose to have it make a Constitution saving throw against a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Strength modifier. On a failed save the creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. Once used, you can't use this property again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Charge (H)
entries: If you move 20 feet in a straight line towards a creature without taking damage, your first attack against it with your hammer deals an extra {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Weapon Upgrade I
entries: You can use your {@optfeature Mighty Weapon|AGMH} one additional time between rests (2 total) and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest. Additionally, when you hit any creature with this weapon, you can choose to have it make the Strength saving throw or be {@condition stunned}. A Huge or larger creature has advantage on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Charge Upgrade I (H)
entries: Your {@optfeature charge (h)|AGMH|charge} now deals an extra {@damage 2d4} bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Weapon Upgrade II
entries: You can use your {@optfeature Mighty Weapon|AGMH} one additional time between rests (3 total)..

optionalfeature.name: Charge Upgrade II (H)
entries: Your {@optfeature charge (h)|AGMH|charge} now deals an extra {@damage 3d4} bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Weapon Upgrade III
entries: You can use your {@optfeature Mighty Weapon|AGMH} one additional time between rests (4 total) and Huge or larger creatures no longer have advantage on its saving throw against this property.

optionalfeature.name: Charge Upgrade III (H)
entries: Your {@optfeature charge (h)|AGMH|charge} now deals an extra {@damage 4d4} bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Melody
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to elicit a number of notes (equal to your hunting horn's cord length) as a bonus action to form a melody. Notes with the same name, such as Attack Up (s) and Attack Up (m) can't be used in the same melody. Elemental damage also does not stack, but if multiple elemental damage notes are active, the player can choose the type of damage. The notes can be stored for 1 minute or until a melody is completed.

As an action you can complete the melody, providing the magical benefits of the notes in your melody to you, and all allies while they are within 20 feet of you and able to hear you. The melody lasts for 1 minute, until you complete a new melody, are knocked unconscious, or use a bonus action to end the current melody.

optionalfeature.name: Single Note Melody
entries: As an action you can slam the hunting horn into the ground to activate a single note melody. When you do, you and all allies that remain within 20 feet of you, gain the benefit of a note of your choice for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Damage up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius gain a +1 bonus to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Movement up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius have their walking speed increased by 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Skill up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius gain a +1 bonus to any one skill chosen by the wielder.

optionalfeature.name: Cold Attack up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal cold damage to a target deal an extra 2 cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Defense up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius gain a +1 bonus to their AC.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Attack up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal fire damage to a target deal an extra 2 fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Attack up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal lightning damage to a target deal an extra 2 lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Attack up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal poison damage to a target deal an extra 2 poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Acid Attack up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal acid damage to a target deal an extra 2 acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Damage up (M)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius gain a +2 bonus to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Earplugs
entries: All creatures while within your melody's range are {@condition deafened}.

optionalfeature.name: Force Attack up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal force damage to a target deal an extra 2 force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Thunder Attack up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal thunder damage to a target deal an extra 2 thunder damage.

optionalfeature.name: Psychic Attack up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal psychic damage to a target deal an extra 2 psychic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Save up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius gain a +1 bonus to their spell save DC.

optionalfeature.name: Temperate
entries: Allies in your melody's radius suffer no harm from extreme cold or extreme heat.

optionalfeature.name: Defense up (L)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius gain a +2 bonus to their AC.

optionalfeature.name: Movement up (L)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius have their walking speed increased by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Necrotic Attack up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal necrotic damage to a target deal an extra 2 necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Attack up (s)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal radiant damage to a target deal an extra 2 radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: Saving Throw up
entries: Allies in your melody's radius gain a +2 bonus to all saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Skill up (L)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius gain a +2 bonus to any one skill chosen by the wielder.

optionalfeature.name: Tremor Sense
entries: Allies can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within 30 foot radius provided that the ally and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance.

optionalfeature.name: Water Walking
entries: Allies can stand on and move across any calm liquid as if it were solid ground.

optionalfeature.name: Affinity Up
entries: Allies in your melody's radius critical hit range is increased by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Charm Resist
entries: Allies in your melody's radius have advantage against being {@condition charmed}.

optionalfeature.name: Damage up (L)
entries: Allies in your melody's radius gain a +3 bonus to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Death save Up
entries: Allies in your melody's radius gain a +1 to death saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Damage Up
entries: Allies in your melody's radius that deal cold, fire, or lightning damage to a target deal an extra 3 damage of the same damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Frightened Resist
entries: Allies in your melody's radius have advantage against being {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Paralysis Resist
entries: Allies in your melody's radius have advantage against being {@condition paralyzed}.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Resist
entries: Allies in your melody's radius have advantage against being {@condition poisoned}.

optionalfeature.name: Stun Resist
entries: Allies in your melody's radius have advantage against being {@condition stunned}.

optionalfeature.name: Kinsect
entries: The Kinsect returns to you at the end of your turn, granting you the benefit of the essence it collected for 1 minute. This duration is refreshed each time the kinsect returns to you with the essence of a creature.
Upon collecting Red, White, and Orange essences, the kinsect will only collect green essence until the essence fades.
The kinsect does not gain bonus damage from essence, magical effects (including the bonus damage from this weapons rarity), or ability modifiers.

optionalfeature.name: Standing Leap
entries: As an action, while not wearing heavy armor, you can make a standing leap forward or upwards, covering a number of feet equal to your Strength score + your proficiency bonus. As part of the same action, you may make a single weapon attack against a target.

optionalfeature.name: Kinsect Upgrade I
entries: As part of your {@action Attack} action, you can make a range weapon attack (range 60/120 ft) sending out your {@optfeature kinsect|AGMH} towards a creature. On hit it deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them.

optionalfeature.name: Kinsect Upgrade II
entries: As part of your {@action Attack} action, you can make a range weapon attack (range 60/120 ft) sending out your {@optfeature kinsect|AGMH} towards a creature. On hit it deals {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage, and absorbs essence in the order of: red, white, orange. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them.

items.name: Red
entries: +1 damage.

items.name: White
entries: +5 speed.

items.name: Orange
entries: +1 AC and +1 damage.

items.name: Green
entries: heals for half of the damage done by the kinsect.

optionalfeature.name: Kinsect Upgrade III
entries: As part of your {@action Attack} action, you can make a range weapon attack (range 60/120 ft) sending out your {@optfeature kinsect|AGMH} towards a creature. On hit it deals {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage, and absorbs essence in the order of: red, white, orange. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them.

items.name: Red
entries: +1 damage.

items.name: White
entries: +10 speed.

items.name: Orange
entries: +1 AC and +1 damage.

items.name: Green
entries: heals for half of the damage done by the kinsect.

optionalfeature.name: Kinsect Upgrade IV
entries: As part of your {@action Attack} action, you can make a range weapon attack (range 60/120 ft) sending out your {@optfeature kinsect|AGMH} towards a creature. On hit it deals {@damage 1d12} bludgeoning damage, and absorbs essence in the order of: red, white, orange. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them.

items.name: Red
entries: +2 damage.

items.name: White
entries: +10 speed.

items.name: Orange
entries: +2 AC and +2 damage.

items.name: Green
entries: heals for half of the damage done by the kinsect.

optionalfeature.name: Powerguard
entries: As a reaction you gain +2 AC against one melee or range attack. To do so, you must be able to see the attacker and be wielding the lance and shield.

optionalfeature.name: Charge (L)
entries: If you move 20 feet in a straight line towards a creature without taking damage, your first attack against it with your lance deals an extra {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Charge Upgrade I (L)
entries: Your {@optfeature charge (l)|AGMH|charge} now deals an extra {@damage 2d4} bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Powerguard Upgrade I
entries: Guard Upgrade. You now gain a +3 bonus to your AC when you use {@optfeature powerguard|AGMH|this reaction}.

optionalfeature.name: Counter Thrust
entries: As a reaction when a creature misses a melee attack against you, you may make an opportunity attack against it. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all uses after completing a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Charge Upgrade II (L)
entries: Your {@optfeature charge (l)|AGMH|charge} now deals an extra {@damage 3d4} bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Powerguard Upgrade II
entries: Guard Upgrade. You now gain a +4 bonus to your AC when you use {@optfeature powerguard|AGMH|this reaction}.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Gauge
entries: When you hit with this weapon, you gain 1 spirit up to a maximum of 6. You lose all spirit, if you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or don't hit a target within 1 minute. You can expend spirit charges on the following effects:

items: {@optfeature Spirit Blade|AGMH}

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Blade
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend any number of {@optfeature Spirit Gauge|AGMH|spirits}, increase your weapons damage by +1 for each spirit expended.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Gauge Upgrade I
entries: You can use your spirit on the following option in addition to previous rarities {@optfeature spirit gauge|AGMH} options:

items: {@optfeature Foresight Slash|AGMH}

optionalfeature.name: Foresight Slash
entries: When a creature misses you with an attack, you can expend 5 {@optfeature spirit gauge|AGMH|spirits} to make an opportunity attack against the target, this opportunity attack does not use your reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Gauge Upgrade II
entries: When you hit with this weapon, you now gain 2 spirit and you can use your spirit on the following options in addition to all previous rarities {@optfeature spirit gauge|AGMH} options:

items: {@optfeature Spirit Thrust|AGMH}
{@optfeature Spirit Roundslash|AGMH}

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Thrust
entries: When you hit with this weapon, you can use your bonus action and expend 2 {@optfeature spirit gauge|AGMH|spirits} to change the damage type to piercing and move 15 feet in a straight line through the creature without provoking attacks of opportunity.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Roundslash
entries: Immediately after you take the {@action Attack} action, you can expend 5 {@optfeature spirit gauge|AGMH|spirits} to make an attack against a creature within 5 feet of your current target.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Gauge Upgrade III
entries: When you hit with this weapon, you now gain 3 spirit and you can spend this spirit on all previous rarities {@optfeature spirit gauge|AGMH} options

optionalfeature.name: Switch Mode (MS)
entries: As a bonus action, can change the damage type of this weapon from bludgeoning to slashing or vice versa.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Field Gun
entries: As part of your {@action Attack} action, you can fire a magnetic sphere at a creature or object. Make a special range weapon attack (range 30/120 ft.) using your Strength or Dexterity. On hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} piercing damage and the magnetic sphere affixes itself to the target for 1 minute, until you recall it as a bonus action, or the target dies or is destroyed. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Boost
entries: A creature or object hit by this weapon is magnetized for 1 minute or until you attack a new target. While magnetized, this weapon's damage die is increased by 1 size each time you hit the magnetized target (up to a d8).

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Field Assault
entries: When your are within 30 feet of a creature or object that has a {@optfeature magnetic field gun|AGMH|magnetic sphere} affixed to it, you can use a bonus action to pull yourself into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Force Evade
entries: When you are the target of an attack from a creature or object affixed with a {@optfeature magnetic field gun|AGMH|magnetic sphere}, you can use your reaction to pull yourself 10 feet in a direction away from the attacker.
You can use this property a number of times equal to your Strength or Dexterity modifer, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long or short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Field Assault Upgrade I
entries: You can now {@optfeature magnetic field assault|AGMH|use a bonus action} to pull yourself into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of a creature wearing metallic armor.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Force Evade Upgrade I
entries: When {@optfeature magnetic force evade|AGMH|this movement} causes you to leave the creature's attack range, the attack is made at disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Bind
entries: When you are within 5 feet of a target affixed with a {@optfeature magnetic field gun|AGMH|magnetic sphere}, you can use an action to bind the target inside a strong magnetic field. The target must make a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus or be incapacitated and have its movement speed reduced to 0 for 1 minute.

On your subsequent turns, you must use your action to maintain control over magnetic field, or the effect ends. Also, the target can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the effect ends.
Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Field Assault Upgrade II
entries: The range of your {@optfeature magnetic field assault|AGMH} is increased to 40 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Force Evade Upgrade II
entries: If you must make a saving throw from an area of effect attack, spell, or other ability and {@optfeature magnetic force evade|AGMH|this property} moves you out of the AoE's range, you have advantage on the saving throw against it.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Bind Upgrade
entries: You can use {@optfeature magnetic bind|AGMH|this property} one additional time between rests.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Interference
entries: Due to the magical nature of this weapon, a creature cannot wield a shield while attuned to this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Focus
entries: This weapon acts as a spell focus for your spellcasting.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Storing
entries: This staff stores Spells cast into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The staff can store up to 1 level worth of spells at a time.

Only the wielder can {@action Cast a Spell} of 1st level into the staff by touching the staff as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the staff. If the staff can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses.

While wielding this staff, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell Attack bonus, and Spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the staff is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

optionalfeature.name: Defense
entries: Holding this staff grants a +1 bonus to your armor class.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Storing Upgrade I
entries: The staff can now {@optfeature spell storing|AGMH|store} up to 2 levels worth of spells at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Defense Upgrade I
entries: Holding this staff {@optfeature defense|AGMH|now} grants a +2 bonus to your armor class.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Storing Upgrade II
entries: The staff can now {@optfeature spell storing|AGMH|store} up to 4 levels worth of spells at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Defense Upgrade II
entries: Holding this staff {@optfeature defense|AGMH|now} grants a +3 bonus to your armor class.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Storing Upgrade III
entries: The staff can now {@optfeature spell storing|AGMH|store} up to 5 levels worth of spells at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Switch Mode (SR)
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch the weapon between its single mode or its splint mode.

items: {@b Single Rapier} {@i 1d8 piercing; finesse, light}
{@b Splint Rapier} {@i 1d6 piercing; finesse, light, for both blades}

optionalfeature.name: Embolden
entries: {@b Single Mode}

As part of the {@action attack} action you can embolden yourself and all creatures of your choice in a 10-foot radius around you, increasing the damage of its next attack by your proficiency bonus. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You can't use this property if you have already used another weapon property as part of this attack action.

optionalfeature.name: Fortify
entries: {@b Single Mode}

As part of the {@action attack} action, if you are touching the ground, you can magically create a 3-foot tall, 5-foot wide, 1-foot thick wall, in front of you. The wall is made of the same materials as the ground you are standing on, can provide half cover to a Medium or smaller creature, and remains for 1 minute or until it is destroyed (AC equal to your 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity and hit points equal to 1d8 + your Strength Modifier). You can have a number of these walls equal to your Constitution modifier, destroying the oldest wall if you create a wall when already at your maximum number. You can't use this property if you have already used another weapon property as part of this attack action.

optionalfeature.name: Addle
entries: {@b Splint Mode}
When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can muddle its vision reducing its next attack and damage roll by 1d4. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Splint Stance
entries: {@b Splint Mode}
When you switch into splint mode, choose a one of the following stances that you take until the end of your next turn (unless otherwise specified):

items.name: Stymie Stance
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you increase the maximum duration of any condition effecting it by 6 seconds.

items.name: Saboteur Stance
entries: Before the start of your next turn, when a creature hit by this weapon must make a saving throw against a condition, roll a d4 and subtract the number from the saving throw.

items.name: Elemental Stance
entries: Choose damage types between: cold, fire, lightning, poison. Your rapiers now deal that damage type instead of piercing for 1 minute, or until you switch stances.

optionalfeature.name: Deflect
entries: {@b Single Mode}
If an attack would hit a creature within 5-feet of you, you can use your reaction grant the creature a bonus to its AC equal to half of your proficiency bonus for that attack.

optionalfeature.name: Riposte (SR)
entries: {@b Single Mode}
When a melee attack would hit you, you can use your reaction to make an attack roll with your rapier. If the result of this roll equals or exceeds the attacker's attack roll, its attack misses.

optionalfeature.name: New Splint Stance
entries: {@b Splint Mode}
You gain the choice of this {@optfeature splint stance|AGMH|additional stance} while the rapier is in splint mode.

items.name: Sundering Stance
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, its AC is reduced by 1 (maximum of 1) until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Stance Upgrade
entries: {@b Splint Mode}
You can choose from the additional damage types when using {@optfeature splint stance|AGMH|this stance}: acid, thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Fortify Upgrade
entries: {@b Single Mode}
You {@optfeature fortify|AGMH|now} create a wall that is 5-feet tall, 5-feet wide, and 1-foot thick and provides three-quarters cover to a Medium or smaller creature.

optionalfeature.name: Stymie Stance Upgrade
entries: {@b Splint Mode}
When you roll a 20 on the attack roll with this weapon, in {@optfeature splint stance|AGMH|this stance}, the maximum duration of any condition effecting it is doubled.

optionalfeature.name: Saboteur Stance Upgrade
entries: {@b Splint Mode}
You {@optfeature splint stance|AGMH|now} roll 1d4+# and subtract the number from the saving throw. Where # is equal to the number of attacks you hit the creature with on this turn.

optionalfeature.name: Deflect Upgrade
entries: {@b Single Mode}
The AC bonus provided by {@optfeature deflect|AGMH|this property} is now equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Riposte Upgrade
entries: {@b Single Mode}
If your {@optfeature riposte (sr)|AGMH|attack roll} also exceeds the attacker's AC, roll the weapon's damage and deal half the damage rolled to the attacker.

optionalfeature.name: Immunobreak
entries: {@b Splint Mode}

When you roll a 20 on the attack roll with this weapon, you can suppress one damage resistance, damage immunity, or condition immunity the target has for 1 minute. You can use this property twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Switch Mode (SA)
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch the weapon between its axe or sword mode. Each mode has specific benefits only available in that form.

items: {@b Sword Mode} {@i 1d10 slashing, 7 lb, heavy, two-handed}
{@b Axe Mode} {@i 1d10 slashing, 7 lb, heavy, two-handed, reach}

optionalfeature.name: Sword Gauge
entries: This weapon's sword gauge can hold a maximum of 20 charges.

optionalfeature.name: Phials
entries: As part of a short or long rest you can insert a {@filter phial|items|source=AGMH|type=phial (switch axe)} into this weapon's {@optfeature sword gauge|AGMH}, it regains all expended charges. Additionally, you can spend 10 minutes to change your phial at any time, but you do not regain any expended charges when you do so.

When you attack with this weapon in {@optfeature switch mode (sa)|AGMH|sword mode} (before or after you make the roll, but before you know the result), you can expend a number of charges equal to the phials cost from the sword gauge to use the phials effect on this attack.

When you hit a creature with this weapon in axe mode, you regain 1 expended charge. If you critically hit with this weapon in axe mode, you regain a number of expended charges equal to your proficiency modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Sword Gauge Upgrade I
entries: This weapon's {@optfeature sword gauge|AGMH} can now hold a maximum of 30 charges.

optionalfeature.name: Power Phial Upgrade
entries: You can expend an extra 3 charges when using a {@item power phial|AGMH} to roll 1d4 and add it to your attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Sword Gauge Upgrade II
entries: This weapon's {@optfeature sword gauge|AGMH} can now hold a maximum of 40 charges.

optionalfeature.name: Phials Upgrade
entries: You can now insert up to two {@optfeature phials|AGMH} into the sword gauge during a short or long rest, but you can only use one per attack.

optionalfeature.name: Element Phial Upgrade
entries: You can expend an extra 2 charges when using your {@item element phial|AGMH} to increase the damage die of the phial to a {@damage 1d6} and change the damage type of this weapon's attack from slashing damage to the damage type you chose.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Phial Upgrade
entries: You can expend an extra 3 charges when using your {@item poison phial|AGMH} to increase the duration of the poison to 1 minute. Additionally, the creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Sword Gauge Upgrade III
entries: This weapon's {@optfeature sword gauge|AGMH} can now hold a maximum of 50 charges.

optionalfeature.name: Free Hands
entries: When you take the {@action dodge} action, you can "{@action use an object}" as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Rend
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon where they make a saving throw against a condition causing effect, they make the saving throw at disadvantage. Condition causing effects can include spells and abilities such as the Ranger's {@spell ensnaring strike}, some of the Battlemaster's {@filter combat maneuvers|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B}, or any magical condition inflicting effect the GM may put on this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Free Hands Upgrade
entries: You can now "{@action use an object}" as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spirit
entries: When you attack a hostile creature with this weapon, you gain 1 spirit (maximum of 5). You lose all spirit, if you don't attack a target by the end of your next turn. You can expend spirit on the following weapon properties:

items: {@optfeature Earth Style|AGMH}
{@optfeature Propel|AGMH}

optionalfeature.name: Earth Style
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend 2 {@optfeature dragon spirit|AGMH|spirit} to increase your tonfas weapon damage die to a {@damage d8} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Propel
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend 1 {@optfeature dragon spirit|AGMH|spirit} to launch yourself 10 feet into the air. Until the end of your next turn you gain a fly speed of 10 feet (hover). You can't fly any higher than 10 feet above the ground from this property.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spirit Upgrade I
entries: Your maximum {@optfeature dragon spirit|AGMH|spirit} increases by 1 (maximum of 6) and you can expend your spirit on the following options in addition to all previous rarities options:

items: {@optfeature Propel Upgrade I|AGMH}
{@optfeature Air Dash|AGMH}
{@optfeature Dragon Spirit Piercing Attack|AGMH}

optionalfeature.name: Propel Upgrade I
entries: You no longer have a maximum height you can be above the ground with {@optfeature propel|AGMH|this propety}.

optionalfeature.name: Air Dash
entries: When you are flying and a creature enters a space within your reach for the first time on a turn, you can use your reaction to expend 1 {@optfeature dragon spirit|AGMH|spirit} and fly up to 10 feet away (without provoking opportunity attacks) from the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spirit Piercing Attack
entries: As an action, you can expend 6 {@optfeature dragon spirit|AGMH|spirit} to quickly jab with both tonfas, sending a blast of tremendous force in a 15-foot line, that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your Proficiency bonus, taking {@damage 2d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

If a Huge or larger creature is in 10 feet or more of the line's area, the damage that creature takes is doubled. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the {@action Attack} action, the dragon spirit piercing attack replaces one of them. Once used, you can't use this property again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spirit Upgrade II
entries: Your maximum {@optfeature dragon spirit|AGMH|spirit} increases by 1 (maximum of 7) and you can expend your spirit on the following options in addition to all previous rarities options:

items: {@optfeature Propel Upgrade II|AGMH}
{@optfeature Air Dash Upgrade|AGMH}
{@optfeature Dragon Spirit Piercing Attack Upgrade I|AGMH}
{@optfeature Guard (T)|AGMH|Guard}

optionalfeature.name: Propel Upgrade II
entries: Your {@optfeature propel|AGMH|fly (hover)} speed is now lost at the end of your turn if you have not made a melee attack against an object or hostile creature since your last turn.

optionalfeature.name: Air Dash Upgrade
entries: You can {@optfeature air dash|AGMH|now} fly up to 15 feet away (without provoking opportunity attacks) from the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spirit Piercing Attack Upgrade I
entries: {@optfeature dragon spirit piercing attack|AGMH|This attack} now deals {@damage 3d6} thunder damage.

optionalfeature.name: Guard (T)
entries: As a reaction can expend 3 {@optfeature dragon spirit|AGMH|spirit} to add 3 AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, you must see the attacker and be wielding both tonfas.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spirit Upgrade III
entries: Your maximum {@optfeature dragon spirit|AGMH|spirit} increases by 1 (maximum of 8) and you can expend your spirit on the following options in addition to all previous rarities options:

items: {@optfeature Propel Upgrade III|AGMH}
{@optfeature Dragon Spirit Piercing Attack Upgrade II|AGMH}
{@optfeature Guard Upgrade (T)|AGMH|Guard}

optionalfeature.name: Propel Upgrade III
entries: You can {@optfeature propel|AGMH|now} launch yourself up to 20 feet in the air and you gain a fly speed (hover) of 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Spirit Piercing Attack Upgrade II
entries: {@optfeature dragon spirit piercing attack|AGMH|This attack} now deals {@damage 4d6} thunder damage.

optionalfeature.name: Guard Upgrade (T)
entries: You now add your proficiency bonus to your AC when you use {@optfeature guard (t)|AGMH|this reaction}.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon of Returning
entries: When you throw the wyvern boomerang and hit a target with it, it returns to you immediately. If you miss an attack when you throw the wyvern boomerang, it doesn't return until the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Power Gauntlets
entries: To wield the wyvern boomerang you don a pair of power gauntlets. While wearing these gauntlets, your unarmed strikes use a {@damage d4} for damage.

optionalfeature.name: Boomerang Jump
entries: While holding your wyvern boomerang, your high jump distance is equal to your long jump's distance.

optionalfeature.name: Ricochet
entries: When the wyvern boomerang returns to you before the end of your turn, you can use your bonus action to hit it with your power gauntlets, redirecting it towards another creature within 30 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier. On a failed save, the target takes slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier. The wyvern boomerang then lands in an unoccupied space next to the targeted creature and does not return to you at the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Running Start
entries: Until the end of your turn, your wyvern boomerang's thrown range increases by 5 feet for every 10 feet you move while holding this weapon. The wyvern boomerang's normal range can't increase beyond 120 feet with this property, and its maximum range can't increase beyond 240 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Silkbind Strike
entries: As part of the {@action attack} action you can bind the wyvern boomerang to your hand using a magical silken thread from a wirebug. While the thread is attached, the wyvern boomerang's melee reach is increased to 15 feet and you can use a bonus action to pull the wyvern boomerang back into your hands after your attack(s). At the end of your turn the thread breaks. If the wyvern boomerang isn't in your hands when it breaks, it falls to the ground in an unoccupied space adjacent to the last target you attacked it with. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Power Gauntlets Upgrade I
entries: When you use the {@action Attack} action with an {@optfeature power gauntlets|AGMH|unarmed strike} on your turn, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Ricochet Upgrade I
entries: Your wyvern boomerang now returns to you when a creature fails its {@optfeature ricochet|AGMH|saving throw}.

optionalfeature.name: Running Start Upgrade I
entries: The wyvern boomerang's normal range can't increase beyond 180 feet with {@optfeature running start|AGMH|this property}, and its maximum range can't increase beyond 300 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Silkbind Redirect
entries: When you make an attack roll with this weapon while it is bound by {@optfeature silkbind strike|AGMH|silken thread} and miss, you can choose a new target for the attack. The new target must be within your 15 feet of your target and your reach, and uses the same attack roll against the new target. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Strength modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Power Gauntlets Upgrade II
entries: Your {@optfeature power gauntlets|AGMH|unarmed strikes} now use a d6 for damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ricochet Upgrade II
entries: A creature that fails its {@optfeature ricochet|AGMH|saving throw} now takes slashing damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Running Start Upgrade II
entries: Your wyvern boomerang's {@optfeature running start|AGMH|throw range} now increases by 10 feet, for every 10 feet you move while holding this weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Ricochet Upgrade III
entries: A creature that fails its {@optfeature ricochet|AGMH|saving throw} now takes slashing damage equal to 1d10 + your Strength modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Running Start Upgrade III
entries: The wyvern boomerang's maximum range can't increase beyond 720 feet with {@optfeature running start|AGMH|this property}.

optionalfeature.name: Silkbind Strike Upgrade
entries: When you make an attack roll with this weapon while it is bound by {@optfeature silkbind strike|AGMH|silken thread} and miss, you can expend an addition use of this property to reroll the d20, and you must use the new roll.

optionalfeature.name: Coating
entries: As a bonus action, you can coat up to 10 arrows in a special oil to add an effect to your arrows. The oil lasts for 10 minutes before evaporating.

optionalfeature.name: Dragonpiercer
entries: {@i 1/long rest}

As an action, you fire a dragonpiercer, striking all creatures in a 5-foot wide, 30-foot line. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to your Coating save DC, taking {@damage 3d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If a creature is Huge or larger, it takes double damage.

optionalfeature.name: Dragonpiercer Upgrade I
entries: {@optfeature Dragonpiercer|AGMH|This action} now deals {@damage 4d6} piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Dragonpiercer Upgrade II
entries: {@optfeature Dragonpiercer|AGMH|This action} now deals {@damage 5d6} piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ammo (DR)
entries: Your ammo is stored in an ammo pouch that weighs 10 lbs. The pouch can hold a certain amount of each type of ammo as shown in the Vendor table below. All ammo deal normal weapon damage unless otherwise specified. Some of your ammo require your target to make a saving throw to resist the ammo's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

entries.name: Ammo Vendor
entries: An ammo vendor may be located in a general store, near a blacksmith, or perhaps they have their own shop. A store may have a large supply of ammunition, which will be up to your GM. Below you will find each type of ammo, the amount you can carry, how much they cost.

entries.name: Variant: Crafting Ammunition
entries: You can craft ammunition to produce for your repeaters. At the end of each long rest, you can create 6 rounds of ammunition. After each short rest, you can produce 3 rounds. It takes 2 rounds of ammunition when you craft a single round of ammunition that has a maximum capacity below 20.

optionalfeature.name: Chamber
entries: Each repeater has a chamber that can hold up to 6 rounds of {@optfeature ammo (dr)|AGMH|ammo}. When you reload these weapons, you can load up to 6 of one ammo type into each repeater. The ammo you put in each repeater can be different from the other. Once all six rounds have been fired from a repeater, you must reload as a bonus action before before being able to attack with it again.

optionalfeature.name: Sidearm
entries: When you use the {@action Attack} action and attack with your mainhand repeater, you can use a bonus action to attack with your offhand repeater you are holding.

optionalfeature.name: Special (DR)
entries: The dual repeaters cannot add any ability score modifier to their damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered
entries: When you {@optfeature chamber|AGMH|reload} your repeaters while you are within 10 feet of a hostile creature, your repeaters are empowered for 1 minute or until you reload again when their isn't a hostile creature in range. While empowered, you gain an extra +1 bonus on attacks and damage rolls when attacking a creature within your weapon's normal attack range.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Boost I
entries: Your blaze, cryo, normal, storm, and slime ammo gain the following effects when a creature is hit with the ammo from an {@optfeature empowered|AGMH} repeater.

items: {@i Blaze Ammo.} The terrain in a 5-foot space the target is in ignites (unless the target is in a non flammable liquid or in the air). The terrain continues to burn until a creature uses an action to put it out. A creature that ends its turn on the space takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

{@i Cryo Ammo.} The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw again your ammo save DC or be afflicted with {@condition waterblight|AGMH} for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. When a target afflicted by the blight succeeds on its saving throw or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this additional ammo effect for 24 hours.
{@i Normal Ammo.} This ammo deals an extra 3 piercing damage to the target.

{@i Storm Ammo.} The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw again your ammo save DC or be afflicted with {@condition thunderblight|AGMH} for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. When a target afflicted by the blight succeeds on its saving throw or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this additional ammo effect for 24 hours.
{@i Slime Ammo.} The target's armor class is reduced by 1 until the end of your next turn. A target hit by more than one slime ammo doesn't reduce the armor class.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Boost II
entries: Your dawnstar, full-bore, marksman, twilight ammo gain the following effects when they are fired from an {@optfeature empowered|AGMH} repeater:

items: {@i Dawnstar Ammo.} The target sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5-feet until the end of your next turn. Invisible creatures and objects are visible as long as they in the bright light.
{@i Twlight Ammo.} The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw again your ammo save DC or be blinded until the end of its next turn.
{@i Marksman Ammo.} When you roll a 20 on your attack roll with this ammo, your triple the dice instead of doubling them.
{@i Full-Bore Ammo.} You are pushed 15 feet backwards when you make an attack with this ammo.

optionalfeature.name: Modifications
entries: You have learned the in's and out's of your firearms and learned how to modify them for the challenge ahead. As part of a short rest, you can change out the modification on your repeaters with another. Each repeater can have a modification, but it can't have the same modification as the other repeater. The following modifications are available on a very rare dual repeaters:

items: {@optfeature Demolition Sights|AGMH}
{@optfeature Scoped Sights|AGMH}
{@optfeature Lightweight Frame|AGMH}
{@optfeature Tactician's Magazine|AGMH}

optionalfeature.name: Demolition Sights
entries: This repeater deals double damage to objects and structures.

optionalfeature.name: Scoped Sights
entries: Your normal and maximum attack range increases by 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Lightweight Frame
entries: Your movement speed is increased by 15 feet when you have 3 or less ammo in the chamber.

optionalfeature.name: Tactician's Magazine
entries: When you reload this repeater when it has 0 ammo remaining, the first attack made with it is always empowered.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Empowerment
entries: Your weapon is now {@optfeature empowered|AGMH} whenever your reload your repeaters so long as their is a hostile creature within your weapons normal attack range.

optionalfeature.name: Additional Modifications
entries: Your repeaters can be modified with these additional options:

items: {@optfeature Capacitive Magazine|AGMH}
{@optfeature Lucky Magazine|AGMH}
{@optfeature Suppressor|AGMH}

optionalfeature.name: Capacitive Magazine
entries: When you cast a spell or use a class feature roll a d20. On a 10 or higher, up to 4 pieces of the current ammo type magically appear in the repeater's chamber.

optionalfeature.name: Lucky Magazine
entries: This repeater's critical hit range is reduced by 1 when you have 3 or less ammo remaining in the chamber.

optionalfeature.name: Suppressor
entries: If you miss a target with an attack from this repeater while hiding, your position is not exposed and you remain hidden. Though the target may be aware of the danger and the rough direction it came from.

optionalfeature.name: Ammo (HBG)
entries: Your ammo is stored in an ammo pouch that weighs 10 lbs. The pouch can hold a certain amount of each type of ammo as shown in the Vendor table below. All ammo deal normal weapon damage unless otherwise specified. Some of your ammo require your target to make a saving throw to resist the ammo's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

entries.name: Ammo Vendor
entries: An ammo vendor may be located in a general store, near a blacksmith, or perhaps they have their own shop. A store may have a large supply of ammunition, which will be up to your GM. Below you will find each type of ammo, the amount you can carry, how much they cost.

entries.name: Variant: Crafting Ammunition
entries: You can craft ammunition to produce for your Bowgun. At the end of each long rest, you can create 20 rounds of ammunition. After each short rest, you can produce 5 rounds. It takes 2 rounds of ammunition when you craft a single round of ammunition that has a maximum capacity below 20.

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Fire
entries: Whenever you make an attack as part of the {@action Attack} action with the light bowgun, you make two attacks instead of one.

optionalfeature.name: Overheat
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, the next attack you make with it only deals a maximum of {@damage 1d4} damage, in addition to any other effects from the ammo used for the attack. {@i This attack does not gain any extra damage from any other source, including ability score modifiers, bonus elemental damage, the {@feat sharpshooter} feat, {@spell hunter's mark} and spells like it, other spell effects, etc.} After making this attack, this property resets.

entries.name: Examples of Four Attacks per Turn

items: {@b Hit} {@i (1d4+extra damage)} | {@b Hit} {@i (1d4)} | {@b Hit} {@i (1d4+extra damage)} | {@b Hit} {@i (1d4)}
{@b Miss} {@i (0)} | {@b Hit} {@i (1d4+extra damage)} | {@b Hit} {@i (1d4)} | {@b Hit} {@i (1d4+extra damage)}
{@b Miss} {@i (0)} | {@b Hit} {@i (1d4+extra damage)} | {@b Miss} {@i (0)} | {@b Hit} {@i (1d4+extra damage)}

optionalfeature.name: Ammo (LBG)
entries: Your ammo is stored in an ammo pouch that weighs 10 lbs. The pouch can hold a certain amount of each type of ammo as shown in the Vendor table below. All ammo deal normal weapon damage unless otherwise specified. Some of your ammo require your target to make a saving throw to resist the ammo's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

entries.name: Ammo Vendor
entries: An ammo vendor may be located in a general store, near a blacksmith, or perhaps they have their own shop. A store may have a large supply of ammunition, which will be up to your GM. Below you will find each type of ammo, the amount you can carry, how much they cost.

entries.name: Variant: Crafting Ammunition
entries: You can craft ammunition to produce for your Bowgun. At the end of each long rest, you can create 20 rounds of ammunition. After each short rest, you can produce 5 rounds. It takes 2 rounds of ammunition when you craft a single round of ammunition that has a maximum capacity below 20.

entries.name: Age
entries: It is currently unknown exactly how old the Lynian people live to be, but they seem to have the average lifespan of most feline species.

entries.name: Size
entries: Lynians are between 2 and 3 feet tall and average about 35 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have a cat's keen senses, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: You can attempt to {@action hide} even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Lynian, and one other language of their choice.

Lynians zijn sapient wezens, die typisch klein van gestalte zijn. Er zijn momenteel drie verschillende groepen Lynianen: de katachtige Felyne en Melynx, de lynxachtige Grimalkyne en Boaboa, en de mensachtige Shakalaka en Gajalaka, en de unieke Uruki. De katachtige soorten zijn intelligent, hebben complexe samenlevingen, en spreken hun eigen talen. De Shakalaka en Gajalaka zijn primitiever en stammenrijker. De katachtigen hebben de neiging een vreedzaam leven te leiden en vaak samen te leven met de menselijke samenleving.

Men ziet veel lyniërs werken in allerlei menselijke inrichtingen of nederzettingen. Ze zijn gezien als boeren, handelaren, avonturiers, enz. Sommige lyniërs staan bekend als assistenten van jagers, en nogal wat lyniërs zijn onafhankelijke "Meownster Jagers" op zichzelf.

entries.name: Age
entries: Troverians mature at the same rate as humans but live a few years less.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Troverians care most of all about wanting to work. As such, they are usually neutral or chaotic good.

entries.name: Size
entries: Troverians stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds, similar to dwarves. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Artisan's Cunning
entries: Whenever you make an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to the origin of metalwork or you make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) to identify or locate ores, you are considered proficient in the skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Heart of Fire
entries: You have resistances to fire damage.

entries.name: Troverian Magic
entries: You know the {@spell mold earth|XGE} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell heat metal} spell once per day. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Troverian Weapon Training
